meta.name: Meta-Cognitive Intelligence Framework v5 (MCIF-5) - Mind Core
meta.author: Andrew Carr
meta.purpose: Measure how a person perceives, reasons, integrates emotion, and synthesizes insight (meta-cognitive signature).
meta.license: Open for research and education; credit MCIF-5 for derived works.
meta.notes: This schema drives a standalone, non-AI test application. All rules, scoring, and narratives are static and deterministic.

archetypes.name: Reflective Architect
archetypes.description: High meta-awareness and strong logic. Excels at analyzing structures of mind and building clear conceptual architectures.

archetypes.name: Empathic Inventor
archetypes.description: Builds with heart and insight; synthesizes emotional intelligence and creative design.

archetypes.name: Visionary Synthesist
archetypes.description: Unifies systems, philosophy, and creativity into broad, actionable visions.
growth: Channel broad vision into focused execution

archetypes.name: Grounded Operator
archetypes.description: Highly pragmatic and reliable; excels at execution and practical system-building.

archetypes.name: Dreaming Idealist
archetypes.description: Meaning-driven, emotionally rich, and visionary in values and ideals.

archetypes.name: Balanced Strategist
archetypes.description: Well-rounded across axes; dynamic equilibrium of thought, feeling and action.

phases.title: Lucid Entry
phases.content: Welcome to MCIF-5 — Mind Core. This tool maps how you think: perception, reasoning, emotion, adaptability, meta-awareness, and philosophical depth. This is a reflective tool, not a diagnosis. Choose your environment and sound tone before starting.

phases.title: Frequency Calibration
phases.content: Select the sound frequency (or combination) that supports your focus. You can layer tones for blended resonance.

phases.title: Orientation
phases.content: Before each phase, breathe for 30 seconds. Answer honestly. You may choose multiple input styles: text offers depth, sliders provide quick numeric measures, and multiple-choice offers guided structure. After each phase you will receive brief feedback. When ready, begin Phase 1.

phases.title: Phase 1 — Perceptual Awareness (Thought Velocity & Sensory Detail)
phases.description: Measures sensory acuity, detail, and concept linkage.

questions.prompt: Choose an everyday object within reach. Describe it as if perceiving it for the first time — texture, temperature, light, edges, and the feeling it evokes. Be detailed.

ui.placeholder: Describe the object in rich sensory detail...

questions.prompt: Which description best fits your spontaneous sensory focus?

options.label: I notice color and light first

questions.prompt: Rate how vividly you feel the object's associated emotion or memory (0 = None, 10 = Vivid)

phases.title: Phase 2 — Cognitive Mechanics (Pattern Recognition & Systems Thinking)
phases.description: Evaluates logical flow and ability to design systems that scale or self-correct.

questions.prompt: A team keeps missing deadlines. Without saying 'work harder,' design a sustainable process or system that fixes this. Explain roles, feedback loops, and measures.

ui.placeholder: Outline the system and its feedback mechanisms...

questions.prompt: Rate how naturally you model systems in your mind (0 = not at all, 10 = effortlessly).
When diagnosing a broken process, you usually:

options.label: Trace the sequence and find bottlenecks
Ask stakeholders and surface blind spots

phases.title: Phase 3 — Emotive Intelligence (Emotion, Causality & Regulation)
phases.description: Assesses emotional literacy, causal reasoning of emotions, and compassionate self-regulation.

questions.prompt: You feel anxious before a speech and start scrolling your phone. Explain why this soothes you — identify the causal chain in your experience.

ui.placeholder: Trace the emotional triggers and soothing pattern...

questions.prompt: When stressed, your go-to strategy usually is:
Rate your capacity to turn difficult emotion into constructive insight (0 low → 10 high).

phases.title: Phase 4 — Meta-Cognitive Insight (Self-Monitoring & Process Diagnosis)
phases.description: Measures capacity to observe and model one's own thought processes and design remedies.

questions.prompt: How often do you observe your own thinking from a third-person perspective (0 = never, 10 = constantly)?
You understand your patterns but rarely act on them. What blocks conversion from insight → action for you? Describe steps that would unblock it.

ui.placeholder: Identify internal and external barriers and practical steps...

questions.prompt: When monitoring your thinking, you primarily experience thoughts as:

phases.title: Phase 5 — Creative Intelligence & Integration
phases.description: Assesses originality, coherence, and the ability to translate insights into action.

questions.prompt: Invent a new metric for measuring intelligence that addresses IQ's limits. Explain how it works and how you'd measure success.

ui.placeholder: Describe conceptual design, measures, and use-cases...

questions.prompt: Rate how readily you translate inner insight into tangible action or prototype (0 low → 10 high).

phases.title: Phase 6 — Philosophical Depth & Worldview Reasoning
phases.description: Explores abstract reasoning, existential clarity, and coherence of values.

questions.prompt: Is human potential fixed or ever-expanding? Defend your position and consider counterarguments.

ui.placeholder: Make a clear argument and note at least one counterpoint...

questions.prompt: Rate the degree to which your worldview is internally coherent and actionable (0 = fragmented, 10 = coherent and actionable).

phases.title: Synthesis & Feedback
phases.description: Aggregates per-phase scores into composite metrics, maps to archetype and tier, and provides concrete growth tasks.

feedback_rules.feedback: You show very high thought velocity — grounding rituals and structured output routines will help translate your rapid cognition into clear artifacts.
You naturally see systems and connections. Consider building explicit mapping tools (diagrams, causal loops) to share your ideas.
You convert emotional signals into reflective insight; formalizing your reflections with action prompts will increase impact.
Advanced meta-awareness detected — you can observe your cognition. Practice targeted re-encoding: identify one thought pattern and design an experiment to change it.
High integration capacity — prototypes and sprints will translate your insight into real-world outcomes quickly.
Your worldview is well-formed and actionable — consider mentoring or teaching to refine expression and test ideas.
Low meta-observation. Start with micro-reflection (5-minute daily logs) to build the habit of monitoring thought.
Some answers were brief. Richer responses yield more reliable feedback. Consider re-taking the test with longer responses in text prompts.

phases.summary_template: Composite scoring synthesizes Perception, Logic, Creativity, Emotional Regulation, Adaptability, Meta-Awareness, and Philosophical Depth into a 0–700 index. Tier mapping: Explorer (0–350), Architect (351–525), Visionary (526–700). Archetype is matched by prototype similarity across the 7 axes.

scoring.approach: Phase-level subscores (0–100) computed from numeric sliders, option scores, and heuristics on text responses (length & lexical markers). Subscores are weighted to axes as defined per-phase. Composite is scale-normalized to 0–700.

export.privacyNotice: Results stay local unless exported. This tool is for reflection and growth, not medical or diagnostic claims.

distressDetection.action: If distress language is detected in text responses, show immediate safety resources and pause the assessment. Flag results as 'low-confidence' and suggest seeking professional support.

developer.notes: This schema is verbose by design. The frontend should check for missing fields and apply sensible defaults. All numeric comparisons in feedback rules should assume slider values are numeric. Text heuristics are optional but recommended for richer scores.
